summary: This appears to be an internal email from November 19, 2019, referencing a New York Times article about an Epstein accuser calling on Prince Andrew to speak with U.S. authorities. The email asks two internal investigative questions: whether a specific 'Jane Doe' has been interviewed and which of Epstein's assistants had red hair.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: Mentioned in the referenced New York Times article as being called upon by an Epstein accuser to talk to U.S. authorities.

persons.name: Jane Doe
persons.context: Referenced in an internal investigative question within the email, asking if she has been interviewed.

events.title: NYT Article on Epstein Accuser and Prince Andrew
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article reporting that a latest Epstein accuser is calling on Prince Andrew to talk to U.S. authorities.

keyFacts: An internal email from November 2019 shows investigators asking questions about interviewing a specific 'Jane Doe' accuser.
The email references a New York Times article from November 18, 2019, about an Epstein accuser calling on Prince Andrew to cooperate with U.S. authorities.
The email contains an investigative question asking which of Jeffrey Epstein's assistants had red hair, suggesting a focus on identifying specific staff members.
